title: DHAIE RAI Service Manifest Schema
description: Semantic self-description schema for Reflexive AI systems enabling services to declare their business purpose, ethical constraints, and semantic dependencies. Repository: https://github.com/designhumanai/dhaie-rai-core

$comment.description: Optional metadata comments for documentation, license headers, and educational purposes. Ignored by validators but valuable for human readers.

@context.$comment: Establishes semantic namespaces. @vocab defaults to schema.org for common properties, dhaie namespace for DHAIE-specific concepts.

@type.$comment: Marks this as a DHAIE Reflexive Service Manifest for semantic web compatibility

@id.description: Globally unique, persistent URI for this manifest
@id.$comment: Should be dereferenceable and stable across service lifecycle. Use versioned paths for schema evolution (e.g., /v2/manifest).

name.$comment: Use business-friendly names, not technical identifiers. Example: 'Cross-Border Payment Engine' not 'payment-svc-v2'

version.description: Semantic version of the service implementation
version.$comment: Follows SemVer 2.0.0. This is the service version, not the manifest schema version.

dhaie:manifestVersion.$comment: Current schema version. Validators MUST accept manifests with same MAJOR version (1.x).

description.description: Technical summary of what the service does
description.$comment: Describe functional capabilities. Complements businessPurpose which describes the 'why'. Keep 1-3 sentences.

dhaie:businessPurpose.description: Why this service exists - the business value it provides
dhaie:businessPurpose.$comment: CRITICAL FIELD for reflexivity. Answer: 'What problem does this solve?' and 'Why would a business pay for this?' Focus on human value, not technical implementation.

dhaie:domainContext.description: Dot-separated path in business architecture (min 3 levels)
dhaie:domainContext.$comment: Locates service in organizational taxonomy. Format: Domain.Subdomain.Capability (e.g., FinTech.Payments.International). Define controlled vocabulary within your org.

dhaie:operations.$comment: Declare primary service capabilities with semantic metadata about state changes, PII handling, and audit requirements. Use category to group related operations.

$comment.description: Optional educational comment for this operation

name.$comment: Use verb-based names: initiateTransfer, scoreRisk, viewRecords

category.$comment: Categories help with architectural understanding. 'compute' for stateless processing, 'orchestration' for multi-service coordination.

mutates.$comment: True for CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE operations, false for READ-only queries. Critical for understanding side effects.

piiFields.description: PII field names involved in operation
piiFields.$comment: List field names that contain Personally Identifiable Information. Triggers consentMechanism requirement at manifest level.

auditRequired.$comment: True for compliance-critical operations (financial transactions, PHI access, admin actions)

dhaie:operations.description: Primary operations exposed by the service

dhaie:ethicalConstraints.$comment: REQUIRED FIELD. Every service must declare at least one ethical/regulatory constraint. This is foundational to DHAIE's ethical-by-design philosophy.

regulation.description: Common name of regulation or standard
regulation.$comment: Use widely recognized names: GDPR, HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, Algorithmic Fairness

uri.$comment: Strongly recommended. Links to authoritative sources enable auditors to verify compliance claims.

articles.$comment: Format: 'Article 6(1)(a)', '45 CFR 164.502', 'Section 1234'. Omit if not applicable.

implementation.description: How the service implements this constraint
implementation.$comment: Be specific about technical controls and procedures. This is auditable documentation.

verificationMethod.$comment: Machine-actionable compliance verification. Include tools and last verification date for audit trails.

type.$comment: automated_scan: CI/CD integrated (e.g., policy-as-code), manual_audit: periodic reviews, third_party_certification: external auditor, continuous_monitoring: real-time compliance checking

tool.description: Name of verification tool or certification body

policyUri.description: Link to machine-readable policy definition (e.g., OPA rego file)

dhaie:consentMechanism.description: How user consent is obtained for data processing
dhaie:consentMechanism.$comment: REQUIRED if: (1) any operation has piiFields, OR (2) any dependency has consentImplications. Use 'no_pii_processed' ONLY if truly no PII is handled. 'explicit_consent_required' is default for GDPR/CCPA compliance.

dhaie:socialImpact.$comment: Optional but encouraged. Quantify positive societal contribution using standardized metrics. Critical for DHAIE's cognitive equity principles.

metrics.$comment: Use standardized metric names from DHAIE taxonomy. Each metric must be an object with name, value, and optional baseline/unit/measurementMethod.

name.$comment: financial_inclusion_index: 0-1 scale measuring access to financial services. cross_border_cost_reduction: percentage savings vs baseline. accessibility_improvement: WCAG compliance or similar. cognitive_equity_score: fairness metric across demographic groups.

baseline.$comment: What was the metric before this service? Essential for measuring improvement.

measurementMethod.$comment: Cite methodology: 'World Bank Financial Inclusion Index', 'WCAG 2.1 AA compliance score', 'Gini coefficient calculation'

description.$comment: Tell the human story. Who benefits? How does this reduce inequality or improve lives? Complement quantitative metrics with qualitative context.

dhaie:semanticDependencies.$comment: Declare service dependencies with business context and consent implications. Use DHAIE Relationship Taxonomy for 'relationship' field. This is semantic architecture, not just technical integration.

$comment.description: Optional educational comment for this dependency

target.$comment: Use the service's 'name' field value, not technical hostname or service ID

targetUri.$comment: Should point to target's @id field for explicit semantic linking. Strongly recommended for knowledge graph construction.

relationship.description: Nature of dependency from DHAIE taxonomy
relationship.$comment: DHAIE Relationship Taxonomy categorizes dependencies by business purpose, not technical implementation. data.provider.* = source of data, risk.assessment.* = risk/fraud checking, orchestration.* = workflow coordination, ledger.* = audit trail, auth.* = authentication/authorization. See manifest-schema.md for complete taxonomy reference.

businessReason.$comment: CRITICAL: Explain the business/regulatory/operational need, not just 'we call this API'. Example: 'AML regulation requires risk scoring for transactions >$10k' not 'calls fraud detection service'.

consentImplications.description: What data is shared and consent implications
consentImplications.$comment: Be explicit about data sharing. If present, parent service MUST declare consentMechanism. State 'No PII shared' when applicable.

condition.$comment: Conditional dependencies model business rules. Use pseudo-code or natural language for 'when'. Do NOT add $comment inside condition object (violates additionalProperties).

enforcementLevel.$comment: mandatory: always enforced (hard requirement), recommended: best practice but skippable, optional: optimization/enhancement only

allOf.$comment: Validation rule: If ANY operation has piiFields, then consentMechanism is REQUIRED and cannot be 'no_pii_processed'
Validation rule: If ANY dependency has consentImplications, then consentMechanism is REQUIRED at manifest level

schemaEvolutionPolicy.description: MAJOR (1.x → 2.x): Breaking changes (remove fields, change types). MINOR (1.0 → 1.1): New optional fields, educational improvements. PATCH (1.0.0 → 1.0.1): Documentation only. Validators MUST accept manifests with same MAJOR version.

added: Support for $comment field at root and within operations/dependencies
Enhanced descriptions for social impact metrics
Improved guidance on relationship taxonomy usage
Examples in $defs based on reference implementations
unchanged: All required fields remain the same

exampleManifests.fintech_payment: examples/payment-service.manifest.json - Cross-border payments with AML/GDPR compliance and conditional fraud detection
exampleManifests.ml_fraud_detection: examples/fraud-detector.manifest.json - ML-powered risk scoring with algorithmic fairness constraints
exampleManifests.healthcare_portal: examples/patient-portal.manifest.json - HIPAA-compliant patient portal with PHI handling and emergency access

relationshipTaxonomyGuide.description: Quick reference for choosing correct relationship types

data_flow.data.provider.realtime: Streaming data (e.g., Market ticker → Price feed)

risk_compliance.risk.assessment.optional: Optional risk scoring (e.g., Credit check for premium)
